intro: Stenandrium harlingii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 inches wide. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbellate inflorescences, which are typical of the Araliaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and private collections.
